div1.p: Know all men by these presents that me George Mason, Alexander Moore &Benjamin Lear are held and firmly bound into Matilda Derrick for herself and her children Lucy, Matilda, & Louisa infants on a petition for freedom in the full and just sum of two hundred dollars to be paid to the said Matilda Derrick certain attorney, executors, administrators, or assigns to which payment well and truly to be made willbind ourselves our heirs, executors and administrators, jointly and personally by these presents, sealed our seals and dated this third day of December in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and twenty three.

Whereas lately at a circuit court of the United States for the District of Columbia in the County of Washington on a suit depending on said Circuit Court. Wherein the said Matilda Derrick for herself and her children Lucy, Matilda and Louisa infants &c petitioners on a petition for freedom and they paid George Mason and Alexander Moore were defendants judgement was rendered against the said George Mason and Alexander Moore and the said George Mason and Alexander Moore having obtained a writ of error, and filed a copy thereof in the Clerk's Office
of the said Circuit Court to reverse the judgment in the aforesaid suit and a citation divided to the said Matilda Derick and her children Lucy, Matilda, & Louisa citing and admonishing them to be and appear at a Supreme Court of the United States to be holden at Washington on the first Monday of February next.

Now the Condition of the above obligation is such that if the said George Mason and Alexander Moore shall prosecute this writ to offer and answer all damages and costs if they face to make this plea good, then the above obligation to be read is to remain in full force and virtue.
Sealed and delivered in presence of E. B. Caldwell
